lines.line: Every morning felt the same since she left.
I remember when she would groom me, teaching me how to be a proper cat.
Now I spend my days watching the world go by without her.
Sometimes I try to play, but my heart isn't in it anymore.
The colorful toys she loved to bat around just remind me she's gone.
I hide away, hoping somehow she'll find me.
But I found others who understand my pain, and slowly, I'm learning to love again.

parsed_script.full_script: Every morning felt the same since she left.  I remember when she would groom me, teaching me how to be a proper cat.  Now I spend my days watching the world go by without her.  Sometimes I try to play, but my heart isn't in it anymore.  The colorful toys she loved to bat around just remind me she's gone.  I hide away, hoping somehow she'll find me.  The loneliness is overwhelming sometimes.  But I found others who understand my pain, and slowly, I'm learning to love again.
